items.title: David's handy JS debugging tip
items.content:
#â€‹604 â€” September 2, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Building an Aircraft Radar System in JavaScript â€” With a title like this, I couldnâ€™t resist checking it out. Charlie digs into some interesting stuff including using WebUSB to interact with a radio to decode ADS-B positioning signals that aircraftÂ transmit. (Before anyone comments, OK, itâ€™s not really a radar but you could plot one!)

Charlie Gerard

12 Useful JavaScript Data Grid Libraries â€” A rundown of some data grid libraries for providing spreadsheet-esque views over datasets â€“ Zara also shares her recommendations on things to consider when making aÂ choice.

Zara Cooper

Stytch Is Your All-In-One Platform for User Authentication â€” With our API and SDKs, you can quickly set up secure, low-friction authentication and authorization for better security, better conversion rates, and a better end user-experience. Try us outÂ today.

Stytch sponsor

JSON Crack: Visualize JSON Data in Graph Form â€” Despite the.. quirky name (it was previously called JSON Visio ğŸ˜¬) this is a handy tool for working with and displaying JSON structures. You can play with it online, embed graphs into your site, or download them for furtherÂ use.

Aykut SaraÃ§

IN BRIEF:

  • Another month, another VS Code release. Context-maintaining 'sticky scroll' is no longer an experimental feature. Ships with TypeScript 4.8. Oh, and rounded buttons ğŸ˜

  • 18 months after jQuery 3.6.0 was released, jQuery 3.6.1 is here as a maintenance release. The fixes and improvements are minor indeed, but I can't help but feel comforted by its continued existence ğŸ¥°

RELEASES:

NodeBB 2.5 â€“ Node.js based forum software.
Faker 7.5 â€“ Generate dummy data on demand.
ReacType 13 â€“ React app prototyping environment.
Lerna 5.5 â€“ Monorepo oriented build system for JS packages.
ESLint 8.23

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Are Default Exports in JavaScript Modules Terrible? â€” Lloyd thinks so and points out that default exports can lead to mismatched and confusing names, so prefers named exports instead. As always, though, it comes down to how you use theÂ feature.

Lloyd Atkinson

Implementing a Promisable setTimeout â€” One of those explorations thatâ€™s more about learning about how things work under the hood, rather than to do anything useful. (If youâ€™re a Node user, the Timers Promises API covers similarÂ ground.)

Dmitry Kudryavtsev

Webinar - AuthN & AuthZ: Security, Compliance, and Other Challenges â€” Join Permit.io and FusionAuth and learn to build Auth that meets your security, compliance, and privacyÂ requirements.

Permit.io sponsor

Understanding React's useMemo and useCallback â€” Many find these hooks confusing. This tutorial goes over what they do exactly and how to get the most out of them â€“ all in Joshâ€™s usual highly accessible and engagingÂ style.

Josh W. Comeau

An Introduction to Dependency Injection â€” â€œDependency injection is, in its essence, about parametrizing things previously hardcoded in functions/classes, so we can control these functions/classes to a greaterÂ extent.â€

Henrique Yuji

In-Browser Compression and Decompression with the Compression Streams API â€” How to write smaller web apps that donâ€™t need to ship their own compression or decompression library - this works in Chrome and Safari Technology PreviewÂ 152.

Thomas Steiner

Integrate eSignatures in Your App in Less Than a Week â€” Enable document signing from anywhere with HelloSign's eSignature functionality. Test the API forÂ free.

HelloSign, a Dropbox Company sponsor

Making a Morphing 3D Sphere with Three.js â€” A striking, modern effect for the Web. CodePen demoÂ included.

Johnny Simpson

Bringing Angular Components to Astro Islands ğŸ â€” Astro has out-of-the-box support for multiple frameworks, but Angular isnâ€™t one of them. Brandon used a project he created called Analog to enable Angular components within an AstroÂ site.

Brandon Roberts

Why React Contexts Are Great (and Why We Didn't Use Them)
Allen Janyska

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Lusift: Library to Create Product Walkthroughs for Your Web App â€” Happy to go vanilla, but has React and Vue integrations too. GitHub repo. Other options in this space are Shepherd and ReactÂ Joyride.

Lusift

Derive Type: Generate Type Definitions for JS Automatically FromÂ Tests â€” Derive types dynamically by running tests to capture value combinations â€“ the idea is to help you manage things while developing functions, particularly if youâ€™re not able to use TypeScript (more from the author on this). Thereâ€™s â–¶ï¸ a screencast that explainsÂ more.

Dr. David A. Kunz

Donâ€™t Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word. Use Shortcut

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Hyper Fetch: A Turbocharged Fetch Library â€” The creator bills it as â€œa mix of Axios and react-query in one, with advanced persistence options.â€ Itâ€™s backend agnostic and offers queues, caching, persistence, and even offline support out of the box. GitHubÂ repo.

Maciej Pyrc et al.

Partytown 0.7: Run Third Party Scripts in a Web Worker â€” The idea is simple: run resource intensive scripts on a separate thread (in a web worker) to let the main thread remain responsive. v0.7 adds an option to execute certain scripts on the main thread which can be useful in some situations (an example is provided). GitHubÂ repo.

Partytown

Sandpack: Component Toolkit for Creating Your Own Live Running Code Editing Experience â€” Created by the folks at CodeSandbox, so they know what theyâ€™re talking about. GitHubÂ repo.

CodeSandbox

TestCafe v2.0.0: Automated End-to-End Testing Tool â€” A popular and long standing testing tool reaches a new milestone and, notably, is the first update to include breaking changes.. so if youâ€™re a user, pay closeÂ attention.

Developer Express Inc.

OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

Jest-Image-Snapshot 5.2 â€“ Jest matcher for image comparisons.
melonJS 13.3 â€“ Browser-based 2D game engine.
peaks.js 2.0.5 â€“ BBC-created audio waveform UI component.
github-script 6.2 â€“ Use JS in GitHub workflows.
Create Rust App 8.2 â€“ Set up a Rust + React app in one command.
Ember Inspector 4.7 â€“ An Ember tab for your DevTools.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior JavaScript/TypeScript Developer (Remote or Warsaw) ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± â€” Join CKEditor team to develop an Open Source project used by millions of users around the world ğŸš€and realize your trueÂ potential.
CKEditor

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

items.title: The future JavaScript features at TC39
items.content:
#â€‹603 â€” August 26, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

If you missed my note two weeks ago, we took last week off, so you didn't miss any issues :-) We're now back every week until Christmas (121 sleeps to go..)
__
Peter Cooper, your editor.

JavaScript Weekly

When Alternative JS Runtimes Grow Up: Deno Has Big Changes Ahead, and the Creator of Bun FormsÂ Oven

Two distinct stories that we felt deserved to be together as they provide a little look at the development of alternative server-side JavaScript runtimes that aren't Node.js and are both going after overlapping markets.

Deno's big news is that they're working hard on npm compatibility and Deno will be able to use most npm modules soon (Deno 1.25 has been released with a preview). Meanwhile, Jarred Sumner, the creator of Bun, has answered our pun prayers and formed Oven, a company to support Bun's development, and already raised $7m for it. The heat is, most certainly, on.

â†’Â  deno.com/blog/changes
â†’Â  oven.sh

DENO AND OVEN

â–¶Â Â On the Future Features of JS â€” Hemanth is a TC39 delegate and hosts the popular TC39er podcast. In this 25-minute talk, he flies through a variety of current language proposals, their progress, and why theyÂ matter.

Hemanth HM

Take a Tour of JavaScript & React Patterns â€” Join Lydia Hallie for the video course covering design patterns you can use to improve the code architecture of your web apps. Learn traditional JavaScript design patterns, React patterns, performance, and readingÂ patterns.

Frontend Masters sponsor

TypeScript 4.8 Released â€” The typed superset of JavaScript continues to remain popular. 4.8 is more a minor evolution than a revolution, but makes improvements to inference, correctness and consistency, file watching, and serious speedups onÂ rebuilds.

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

Crawlee: A New Web Scraping / Automation Library for Node.js â€” Itâ€™s always neat to see a new project launched with some fanfare. Crawlee gets a 3 minute introductory screencast, a launch post, and a nice homepage. It builds on top of things like Puppeteer and Playwright but can handle proxies, retries, spidering, working around blocks, and theÂ like.

Apify

IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸ›° JavaScript is in space! The James Webb Space Telescope runs JavaScript onboard, though not in quite the same way as we all run it.

  • How do you pronounce JSON? Douglas Crockford, who basically came up with it in the first place, â–¶ï¸ explains all here. But what about tabs vsÂ spaces..?

  • If you have any apps deployed on Heroku's free tier, be aware of changes coming to Heroku in the next few months that may mean you need to migrate elsewhere. (Replit and Fly.io are options we're keen on.)

  • Node 18.8.0 is out and introduces easy support for creating and loading user-land snapshots.

  • PlanetScale, a serverless MySQL platform, has introduced an official serverless driver for JavaScript that's Fetch API compatible.

  • Storybook 7.0 is now in alpha with some nice design changes.

RELEASES:

Solid 1.5 â€“ Declarative and flexible JS UI library.
Fiddle 0.30 â€“ Electron playground tool.
Capacitor 4.1 â€“ Cross-platform JS native app platform.
Note: There are more at the end of the issue.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Understanding When and Why React Re-Renders â€” The processes around rendering are important to understand if you want to get the best performance possible from your React apps, so learn why and when React re-renders in the first place.

Josh W. Comeau

â¤ï¸ Loving console.log Is Easy, but Hate ğŸ˜¡ Losing Context to View MessyÂ Output â€” Developer productivity tools Wallaby.js, Quokka.js, and Console Ninja (coming soon) show console.log values and errors right next to yourÂ code.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Popular Node.js Patterns and Tools to Reconsider? â€” Yoni is well known for his work in cataloging Node best practices (certainly worth looking at!) but he thinks we should reflect upon entrenched approaches over time. Here he presents 9 common approaches to reconsider.

Yoni Goldberg

(Re-)Introducing Gatsby as a 'Reactive Site Generator'? â€” Gatsbyâ€™s new focus is on enabling teams to deploy content rapidly with a new architecture that they say allows Gatsby Cloud to publish to its CDN in under a second. This post benchmarks Gatsbyâ€™s â€œReactive Site Generationâ€ (RSG) approach against most traditionalÂ approaches.

Kyle Mathews

Advanced TypeScript Patterns: API Contracts
Jon Mellman

My Experience of Speaking at VueConf US 2022
Austin Gil

Installing and Running Node.js bin Scripts
Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

pico.js: Face Detection Library in 200 Lines of JS â€” The author of a C-based face detection library has turned his hand to JavaScript and hereâ€™s the end result. Thereâ€™s a live demo that runs well and the linked post explains how it works inÂ depth.

Nenad MarkuÅ¡

GopherJS: A Go(lang) to JavaScript Transpiler â€” The latest beta brings it up to Go 1.18 (though without generics for now, alas) and ES6/ES2015 standards. Thereâ€™s an online playground if you want to have a quickÂ play.

GopherJS

Introducing the Most Powerful Free Plan in CI/CD â€” No limits on concurrent jobs, pipelines, CPU, or memory. Built-in tracking & monitoring for tests. 10,000Â minutes/month.

Buildkite sponsor

inappbrowser.com: See What JS is Injected by In-App Browsers â€” The idea is simple: you share the URL https://inappbrowser.com/ within an app of choice, click through to it, and the resulting landing page will tell you if it detects any JavaScript or CSS it didnâ€™t supplyÂ itself.

Felix Krause

Node v16.17.0 (LTS) Released â€” A useful LTS release with a couple of modern backported features â€“ this time, 16.x users gain access to the util.parseArgs CLI argument parsing function, the experimental ESM loader hooks API, and the node:test module andÂ runner.

MichaÃ«l Zasso

NodeGui: Build Cross Platform Desktop Apps with JS and CSS â€” Differs from Electron in using the Qt GUI framework which can make things more complicated but also more efficient in terms of memoryÂ use.

NodeGui

Free Activity Feeds & Chat APIs for Qualifying Teams

Stream sponsor

react-easy-crop 4.5: A Component to Crop Images and Videos
Valentin Hervieu

Seven Tools for Creating a New React App
Jonathan Saring (Bit)

OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

Focus Trap 7.0 â€“ Trap the focus within a DOM node (e.g. a modal).
Electron Packager 16.0 â€“ Customize and package Electron apps.
DOMPurify 2.4 â€“ Fast, tolerant XSS sanitizer for HTML and SVG.
vue-advanced-chat 2.0 â€“ Agnostic chat room component.
Soketi 1.4 â€“ Fast, resilient WebSocket server on Node.
Mineflayer 4.4 â€“ API to create Minecraft bots.
calendar-base 2.0 â€“ Base methods for generating calendars.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior JavaScript/TypeScript Developer (Remote or Warsaw) ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± â€” Join the CKEditor team to develop an Open Source project used by millions of users around the world ğŸš€and realize your trueÂ potential.
CKEditor

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ¥³Â A Quick Bit of Fun

Head straight back to the 90s / early 00s and enjoy some retro Web cursor effects. Next up: custom scrollbars, 10px Tahoma, and scrolling frames everywhere.

items.title: A way to automatically generate regexes from examples
items.content:
#â€‹602 â€” August 12, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

â˜€ï¸ We're taking a rare week off next week for a brief summer vacation so there won't be any issue on August 19 â€“ we'll be back on August 26, complete with a sun tan wind burn, and all the latest JavaScript news, of course :-)
__
Peter Cooper, your editor.

JavaScript Weekly

Code Golfing Tips and Tricks for Smaller JavaScriptÂ Code â€” Writing code thatâ€™s as terse as possible isnâ€™t usually desirable â€“ it's not fun for your coworkers, and your build process might minify your code anyway! But if you need to squeeze into as few characters as possible and some messiness is tolerable.. this is a thorough list of ideas and a learning experience in its ownÂ right! (Quite a few of these come from this classic "byte saving techniques" page, BTW.)

Ciprian

Astro 1.0: The Fast Islands-Based Frontend Framework â€” Despite its relative youth, Astro has had a big impact already with a wide range of users and support for, well, almost every other framework or dev tool going. It's based around â€˜islandsâ€™ where fast HTML can stand in for components which can then be lazily loaded in as user interactions demand. 1.0 introduces new image and picture components, MDX/Markdown support, and SSR builds. Thereâ€™s a new homepageÂ too.

Fred Schott

Add Excel-Like Spreadsheet Experiences to Your JS Apps â€” SpreadJS is the industry-leading JavaScript spreadsheet for adding advanced spreadsheet features to your enterprise apps. Build finance, analysis, budget, and other apps. Excel I/O, 500+ calc functions, tables, charts, and more. View demosÂ now.

SpreadJS from GrapeCity sponsor

Patterns.dev: Modern Web App Design Patterns â€” A free book you can download in PDF format or enjoy on the Web. Learn about lots of fundamentals, from how different styles of rendering or importing resources work to performance optimizations and case studies. Thereâ€™s a lot to enjoy and a fantastic team behind it, too.

Lydia Hallie, Addy Osmani, and Others

IN BRIEF:

  • Three months on from 4.7, TypeScript 4.8 is now in release candidate stage. Most of the enhancements relate to inference, type narrowing, and fileÂ watching.

  • ğŸ”’ GitHub is proposing to use SigStore as a way for users and tools to verify npm package provenance as a way to improveÂ security.

  • The â–¶ï¸ latest episode of the TC39er podcast features an interview with Bloomberg's Robin Ricard, known for his work on the Records and Tuples proposal.

  • Lizz Parody walks us through the proposal to support type annotations within JavaScript code (yes, not TypeScript!)

RELEASES:

Playwright 1.25.0 â€“ Browser remote control and runner toolkit.
Lerna 5.4 â€“ Build system for multiple JS projects in one repo.
Fastify 4.4 â€“ Fast, low overhead web framework.
NodeBB 2.4 â€“ Node.js based forum software.
Color.js 0.4 â€“ Color conversion & manipulation library.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

'How and Why We Removed jQuery from GOV.UK' â€” Weâ€™ve mentioned the UK government digital teamâ€™s culling of jQuery in passing a few times this year, but now thereâ€™s a (brief) explanation of how itÂ happened.

Andy Sellick (GDS)

How To Use Multithreading in Node.js â€” A practical walkthrough to how Node uses threads and how and why you might use worker threads yourself in a webÂ app.

Stanley Ulili (for DigitalOcean)

How to Monitor a Node.js Application â€” Set up monitoring for an open source application with New Relic using instant observability for Node.jsÂ quickstart.

New Relic sponsor

â–¶Â Â Record and Tuple: Immutable Data Structures in JS â€” A JSNation 2022 talk looking at the motivation behind a proposal currently advancing through TC39. (22Â minutes.)

Robin Ricard

Modelling Stable Fluids with Three.js â€” Math, math, shaders, and moreÂ math.

Misaki Nakano

Will Bun Take Node's Crown? â€” Another comparison.
Tomas Fernandez opinion

â–¶Â Â Let's Build Tetris: A Multi-Part Series
Joe Boyle

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Grex: A Way to Generate Regular Expressions from ProvidedÂ Examples â€” This demo is quite fun to play with. Grex is a Rust-based improvement of a JavaScript project which, by way of WebAssembly can be used from JavaScript once again. Itâ€™s quite a neat idea and while itâ€™s not perfect, it can provide you with some inspiration for crafting regexes. GitHubÂ repo.

Peter M. Stahl

Cloudscape: AWS's React Component Design System â€” Built for and used by Amazon Web Services, you get 66 components, opinionated guides on design best practices, and manyÂ demos.

Amazon Web Services

Donâ€™t Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word. Use Shortcut â€” The best issue tracking software is one that software developers are actually happy toÂ use.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Million 1.12: A Fast and Small Virtual DOM Implementation â€” Focused on performance and shipping at under 1KB compressed, Million is ideal if you want an agnostic VDOM implementation to use when building your own framework or just to go a little lower level. â€œThink of it as if Reactâ€™s API and Svelteâ€™s compiler had aÂ baby.â€

Million

React Rating: Easy Star Ratings Component â€” SVG-based. No dependencies. Check out the many examples to see if it gets your â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

Simone Mastromattei

Size Limit 8.0: Performance Budgeting Tool for JavaScript â€” Calculate the real â€˜costâ€™ to run your JS app or lib to maintain an eye on performance and raise an error (in CI, say) when things go awry. Supports ES modules and treeÂ shaking.

Andrey Sitnik

svg2pdf.js: Browser Based SVG to PDF Converter â€” Thereâ€™s an online playground to give you a feel for what it canÂ do.

yWorks GmbH

brotli-wasm: Brotli Compressor and Decompressor â€” Covers both Node and the browser by means ofÂ WebAssembly.

HTTP Toolkit

Never Code an Email API Template Again

Courier.com sponsor

Grakkit: A Modern JS Dev Environment for Minecraft â€” Brings together JS and Minecraft by way ofÂ GraalVM.

Grakkit Project

React Colorful 5.6: A Small Color Picker Component for (P)react â€” Nice demo that changes the color of theÂ homepage.
Vlad Shilov

React DayPicker v8: A Date Picker Component
Giampaolo Bellavite

string-left-right: Find the First Non-Whitespace Character to the Left or Right of aÂ GivenÂ Index
Roy Revelt

OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

Jayson 4.0 â€“ JSON-RPC client/server for Node.
vite-plugin-eslint 1.8 â€“ ESLint plugin for Vite.
Faker 7.4 â€“ Generate massive amounts of fake data.
COBE 0.6 â€“ 5KB WebGL globe lib. (Demo.)
html-to-image 1.10 â€“ Generate images from DOM nodes.
Juice 8.1 â€“ Inlines CSS stylesheets into your HTML source.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Node.js Developer (Remote or Warsaw) â€” Join our backend team responsible for CKEditor Cloud Services and develop an Open Source product used by millions of usersÂ worldwide.
CKEditor

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ˜® WOW OF THE WEEK

If you've got a few minutes, â–¶ï¸ this video of a recent winning 'demo' from a demoscene contest is pretty mindblowing.

The code was written in 2022, but is running on a 1981 IBM PC using CGA graphics and if you're old enough to have used such a machine (like me!) it's amazing what they've managed to squeeze out of it. As one commenter (Jeff Haluska) said: "I have been programming for about 25 years and Area 5150 has me questioning everything I know about computers."

items.title: Genius misuse of WOFF 2 and Brotli to win a JavaScript contest.
items.content:
#â€‹601 â€” August 5, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

JS1024 2022 Competition Winners â€” JS1024 is an annual â€˜code golfingâ€™ contest where you get 15 days to create a cool JavaScript or GLSL program within 1024 bytes. Naturally this brings out a lot of creativity and trickery, but also amazing (non-minified) source to check out. The winning JS entry is this quirky typing game and the winner shader is a sinister 3D tunnel experience. Thereâ€™s a lot to look through and learn from because these developers are using every trick in theÂ book, including compressing 1900+ English words into one of the entries..!

JS1024

Docusaurus 2.0 Released â€” Docusaurus powered sites are everywhere in the JS space lately (look at the Babel docs, for example), and after four years of effort, version 2.0 of the popular React-powered documentation-focused static site generator has landed. This new version was rebuilt from scratch, and adds MDX support, a new plugin system, theming, dark mode, SPA navigation, offline support, andÂ more.

Meta (Facebook)

Announcing EdgeDB 2.0 â€” Try the database that makes ORMs obsolete. EdgeDBâ€™s TypeScript client has the simplicity of an ORM but the power of a full-fledged query language. And with the release of EdgeDB 2.0 itâ€™s better than everâ€”read the announcement forÂ details.

EdgeDB sponsor

Electron 20: The Cross Platform Desktop App Platform â€” As much as 20 sounds like a substantial, round version number, itâ€™s mostly a typical release. Chromium gets bumped up to v104, V8 to 10.4, and Node to 16.15.0. Windows gains an â€˜immersive dark modeâ€™ and itâ€™s now possible for Electron windows to â€˜floatâ€™ over full-screen appsÂ panel-style.

Charles Kerr

IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸ” npm query is a new command in the latest version of npm that lets you query your project's dependencies using a CSS-like selector format.

  • Remember the guy who built JavaScript games using Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint as a canvas? He's back building â–¶ï¸ a multiplayer game in Word. Just 3-minutes and wonderfully wacky.

  • There's a new VS Code release and while the JS debugging features see improvements, â–¶ï¸ this 'sticky scrolling' feature is particularly neat as it keeps your function signatures on screen even during longÂ functions.

  • If you use AWS's Lambda serverless platform for running your functions and you use it a lot, their new tiered pricing structure may yield some big savings.

RELEASES:

Parcel 2.7
Ionic 6.2 â€“ Cross-platform app building toolkit.
Redwood 2.2 â€“ React-backed full-stack framework.
Cypress 10.4 â€“ Popular testing approach for anything browser-based.
Ohm 16.4 â€“ Parser / interpreter building toolkit.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Checking if Native JavaScript Functions are 'Monkey Patched' â€” Along with JavaScriptâ€™s dynamism comes the potential for functions to be overridden (or â€˜monkey patchedâ€™, as some people call the idea of runtime modifications) but there are (imperfect) ways to see if this hasÂ occurred.

Matteo Mazzarolo

On Building Modern Webapps Faster with Bud â€” Bud (no, not Bun) is a relatively new Go(lang) and JavaScript powered full-stack web framework with a lot of good ideas â€“ â–¶ï¸ this 15-minute video on creating a Hacker News clone with it is a fun demo. If Go works for you on the backend, it's worth aÂ look.

Preslav Rachev

Level-Up Your Cypress Testing Knowledge for Free â€” Learn from top industry experts with over 25 lessons on how to get started withÂ Cypress.

Cypress.io sponsor

From 500ms to 1.7ms in React â€” A sluggish customized grid triggered a journey to analyze some bottlenecks, followed by some tweaks resulting in a dramatic perfÂ improvement.

Oren Farhi

Parsing Command Line Arguments with util.parseArgs() inÂ Node.js â€” A feature added in Node 18.3, just thisÂ year.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Use Jest to Replace Default Test Runners in an Angular Project
Rob Bell

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

vue-grid-layout: Draggable and Resizable Grid Layout for Vue.js â€” Like Gridster.js (from the jQuery days!) , but for Vue.js. Thereâ€™s a demo right on the homepage. GitHubÂ repo.

JBay Solutions

safe-json-value: For When JSON Serialization Mustn't Fail â€” Prevents JSON.serialize() from throwing an exeception, changing types, or otherwise transforming values unexpectedly, because sometimes you need that sort ofÂ reassurance.

ehmicky

Quokka.js Is the #1 JavaScript / TypeScript Scratchpad for VS Code â€” Ideal for exploring and testing JavaScript. Code runs immediately as you type with feedback right next to yourÂ code.

Wallaby.js sponsor

colorgrad: High-Perf, Rust-Powered Color Gradient Library â€” Uses Rust compiled to WebAssembly behind the scenes â€“ very modern! Itâ€™s also a nice small codebase with which to learn the technique if you want to try it too. LiveÂ demo.

Nor Khasyatillah

Embla Carousel 7: Carousel with Fluid Motion and 'Swipe Precision' â€” A much maligned UI element, but the examples worked pretty well for us. Library agnostic but has easy integrations for React, Vue, and Svelte, if you needÂ them.

David Jerleke

Nativefier: Make Any Web Page a Desktop App â€” A basic Node.js-powered tool for creating a desktop â€˜appâ€™ for any Web site using Electron as the webview. For Windows, macOS andÂ Linux.

Goh Jia Hao

ts-version: Access the Current TypeScript Version from Types â€” The creator puts it best: â€œFrustrated how TS versions handle your package slightly differently, but donâ€™t want to ship a full copy of your types with TypesVersions? Now you can adjust your types depending on the TSÂ version!â€

Lenz Weber-Tronic

Integrate eSignatures in Your App in Less Than a Week

HelloSign, a Dropbox Company sponsor

PowerGlitch: A Tiny Library to 'Glitch' Images on the Web
PowerHat

OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

React Native Boilerplate 3.5 â€“ A starter template for RN apps.
Stripe Node 10.0 â€“ Node.js library for Stripe's API.
Electron Store 8.1 â€“ Simple data persistence for Electron apps.
Meriyah 4.3 â€“ Compliant, self-hosted JS parser. (Demo)
React Spreadsheet Grid 2.3 â€“ Excel-like grid component for React.
Inferno 8.0.2 â€“ Fast, React-like library.
âˆ¿ Peaks.js 2.0.3 â€“ BBC's audio waveform UI component.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior JavaScript Developer (Warsaw or Remote) ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ â€” Open Source rich text editor used by millions of users around the world. Strong focus on code quality. Join the CKEditorÂ team.
CKEditor

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

â“ Did you know..

  • There's a useful curated list of over 150 static site generators and relatedÂ resources? If you want to cast a wider net and stretch the SSG definition a little, here are hundredsÂ more.

  • On macOS, if you hold down Option (âŒ¥) when resizing a window, it resizes from all directions at once? Handy for those windows that wander offÂ screen.

  • ğŸ¶ Rewarding a dog for rescuing people in danger can have unintended negativeÂ consequences?
